byline.contributor: Joanna Berendt contributed reporting from Warsaw.

abstract: Sebino Plaku, who plays for Polish professional soccer team Slask Wroclaw, is challenging practice known as training alone, in which club punishes player physically and psychologically for refusing to accept its demands; claims in arbitration case against club that he was forced to train three times day alone after he refused to accept salary reduction of more than 50 percent; his account highlights larger labor issue in European soccer.

headline.print_headline: Europe Soccer Uses Bullying in Pay Feuds
headline.main: A Challenge to Soccer’s Version of Solitary Confinement

snippet: A European player is challenging a practice known as training alone, soccer’s version of solitary confinement, in which a player is forced to accept an employer’s demands or endure a punitive regimen.
